post_text: Haven’t received your P-EBT card in the mail yet? If you are a family with children eligible for free or reduced-price school meals you may receive up to $365 in food benefits. Apply today at ca.p-ebt.org before June 30, 2020.
text: Haven’t received your P-EBT card in the mail yet? If you are a family with children eligible for free or reduced-price school meals you may receive up to $365 in food benefits. Apply today at ca.p-ebt.org before June 30, 2020.

post_text: Families that qualify for free or reduced-price school meals may get $365 per child in state benefits to buy food. Families who received a P-EBT card in the mail do not need to apply. The application is easy; apply today and you should receive your benefits within 10 days! Apply at ca.p-ebt.org and visit ca.p-ebt.org/info for more information.
text: Families that qualify for free or reduced-price school meals may get $365 per child in state benefits to buy food. Families who received a P-EBT card in the mail do not need to apply. The application is easy; apply today and you should receive your benefits within 10 days! Apply at ca.p-ebt.org and visit ca.p-ebt.org/info for more information.

post_text: P-EBT cards are on the way! Families with children who receive CalFresh, CalWORKs, Medi-Cal, or Foster Care benefits are automatically eligible for up to $365 in P-EBT food benefits. Learn more at ca.pebt.org

post_text: We are ready! PVSD staff has been working exceptionally hard over the last few weeks to prepare for distance learning. Please be sure to keep in touch with your teacher(s) should you have any questions. We are here to support you and our student learners! I have been so inspired, from our classified staff who are serving our students to our creative educators who continue teaching remotely, to our parents who are supporting students at home - we are truly partners in education.

post_text:
San Mateo County Elections Office notified us that due to a printing error, some voters in Woodside did not have Measure P printed on their ballot (Measure P is the measure on the March ballot that would renew the District’s existing local parcel tax measure at the $581 rate and add a 3% annual increase). The County informed us that voters have been sent replacement ballots that should arrive this week. Once you receive your replacement ballot, you can discard your original ballot. If you already voted, you can still vote with your replacement ballot - the County will simply discard your original ballot once the replacement is received.

For any questions, please contact the County Elections Office directly at 650-312-5222

The County informed us that voters have been sent replacement ballots that should arrive this week. Once you receive your replacement ballot, you can discard your original ballot. If you already voted, you can still vote with your replacement ballot - the County will simply discard your original ballot once the replacement is received.

For any questions, please contact the County Elections Office directly at 650-312-5222

post_text:
Hello PVSD Community,
At their meeting last Wednesday, the PVSD Board of Trustees discussed the following topics:

1. Hands- on learning: alignment to the PVSD Blueprint for Excellence, visual and performing arts; STREAM (science, technology, reading, engineering, arts, math); MakerSpaces, project based learning, student showcases and extracurricular opportunities

2. Review and approve the schools' Comprehensive School Safety Plans

3. Report on the Governor's 2020-2021 budget proposal

4. Discussion of District priorities

5. Approval of 2020 - 2021 Board of Trustees meeting dates

6. Measure Z Bond Project and Facilities Update

Click here to see the Board agenda, meeting notes, and attachments: https://go.boarddocs.com/ca/portola/Board.nsf/Public

We invite the PVSD community to attend the Board's Study Session on Wednesday February 12 at 8:30am at the PV District Office Annex.

Please let me know if you have any questions or input.

Thank you for your support of our schools,
Roberta
text:

2. Review and approve the schools' Comprehensive School Safety Plans

3. Report on the Governor's 2020-2021 budget proposal

4. Discussion of District priorities

5. Approval of 2020 - 2021 Board of Trustees meeting dates

6. Measure Z Bond Project and Facilities Update

Click here to see the Board agenda, meeting notes, and attachments: https://go.boarddocs.com/ca/portola/Board.nsf/Public

We invite the PVSD community to attend the Board's Study Session on Wednesday February 12 at 8:30am at the PV District Office Annex.

Please let me know if you have any questions or input.

Thank you for your support of our schools,
Roberta

post_text: Global Read Aloud Updates: One class is using the book Amal Unbound to teach about symbolism. The cover of the book symbolizes Amal's journey so students created their own covers (hands) to symbolize their own journeys.
text: Global Read Aloud Updates: One class is using the book Amal Unbound to teach about symbolism. The cover of the book symbolizes Amal's journey so students created their own covers (hands) to symbolize their own journeys.

post_text: PVSD is in the process of adopting a new History/Social-Science curriculum. Please stop by the office at either school site to have a look at the materials and fill out a feedback form. We're excited to embrace a new curriculum that matches the new framework for History/Social Science. For more information on the adoption process, head to the PVSD website. (http://pvsd.net/departments/edservices/historypilot)

post_text:
Thanks to a National Science Foundation Grant, CMS has been working with MIT and MakerEd this summer to develop engaging assessments relating to making and core content. Learn more: https://tsl.mit.edu/projects/beyond-rubrics/

We are excited to be chosen as one of two schools in the nation! Thanks to PVSF for helping to fund the makerspace 3-years ago!

post_text: In the wake of the horrific Florida shooting it is important to talk with and observe our children. Take a look at this document the NASP developed.
shared_text:
National Association of School Psychologists
February 14, 2018 at 2:38 PM ·

Families and school personnel play a critical role in helping to reestablish a sense of normalcy and security for children after an act of violence occurs. This infographic provides tips for how to talk to youth about violence.

Learn more: http://bit.ly/2khji7j #NASPprepared
